## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(lubridate)

CU <- read.csv("C:/Users/G50/Documents/R pRogRams/BCCU.csv", na.strings=c("","NA"))

str(CU)

CU <- data.frame(lapply(CU, as.character), stringsAsFactors=FALSE)


CU$ISBN <- str_sub(CU$ISBN, end = 13)

CU$ISBN <- gsub("[a-z, A-Z, Ô]*", "", CU$ISBN)
CU$ISBN <- gsub("[-, !, @, #, $, %, ^, &, , *, :, -, ., ;, /]", "", CU$ISBN)
CU['ISBN']


CU$autorPrincipal <- gsub("^.{0,2}", "", CU$autorPrincipal)
CU["autorPrincipal"]
CU$autorPrincipal <- gsub("[0-9]*", "", CU$autorPrincipal)
CU$autorPrincipal <- gsub("Ô", "", CU$autorPrincipal)
CU$autorPrincipal <- gsub("[-, .]", " ", CU$autorPrincipal)

CU$autorSecundario <- gsub("^.{0,2}", "", CU$autorSecundario)
CU["autorSecundario"]
CU$autorSecundario <- gsub("[0-9]*", "", CU$autorSecundario)
CU$autorSecundario <- gsub("Ô", "", CU$autorSecundario)
CU$autorSecundario <- gsub("[-, !, @, #, $, %, ^, &, , *, :, -, ., ;, /]", " ", CU$autorSecundario)

CU$materia <- gsub("^.{0,2}", "", CU$materia)
CU["materia"]
CU$materia <- gsub("Ô", "", CU$materia)
#CU$materia <- gsub("x", " ", CU$materia)
CU$materia <- gsub("õn", "ñ", CU$materia)
CU$materia <- gsub("[-, !, @, #, $, %, ^, &, , *, :, -, ., ;, /]", " ", CU$materia)



write.csv(CU, file = "BiblioBCC.csv")
```
